solution_line_template: The total cost of the four T-shirts is {num_tshirts} x ${cost_tshirt} = $<<{num_tshirts}*{cost_tshirt}={total_cost_tshirts}>>{total_cost_tshirts}.
Three pairs of pants cost {num_pants} x ${cost_pants} = $<<{num_pants}*{cost_pants}={total_cost_pants}>>{total_cost_pants}.
Two pairs of shoes cost {num_shoes} x ${cost_shoes} = $<<{num_shoes}*{cost_shoes}={total_cost_shoes}>>{total_cost_shoes}.

The total amount of all the items is ${total_cost_tshirts} + ${total_cost_pants} + ${total_cost_shoes} = $<<{total_cost_tshirts}+{total_cost_pants}+{total_cost_shoes}={total_cost_before_discount}>>{total_cost_before_discount}.

Thus, Eugene will get a discount of {discount_percentage}/{discount_divisor} x ${total_cost_before_discount} = ${discount_amount}. Therefore, Eugene will have to pay ${total_cost_before_discount} - ${discount_amount} = $<<{total_cost_before_discount}-{discount_amount}={final_cost}>>{final_cost}.
